fields.description:
Whenever I edit a repo online in a browser bitbucket makes the commit as my "full name". Why does it use this instead of the git username? Thats the purpose of the git username.

There should be a way to change this behavior because it means I cant edit online without breaking my CDCI processes that rely on the git username.
fields.summary: Allow option to set git username for online commits

fields.description:

For example, I want to run my pipeline "deploy" for 50 different host/user/password sets.\\
Or same for 50 different values of "DEPLOY_DIR" environment variable.

Of course, I could just copypaste list of scripts 50 times with different values, but it would be a nightmare when I need to make any modifications.

I read somewhere that Atlassian can manually and temporarily restore read-write permissions in this state so I'd like to have that done so I can push my changes.

Maybe this behaviour could be appliable to other cases.

fields.description:
I cannot any longer push to or pull from a Bitbucket repository from Raspbian (Debian on Raspberry Pi). It worked before but it suddenly stopped working.

I get the following error message:

{code}
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

It seems my public ssh key is correct and recognised, but after that something goes wrong because I cannot login with ssh to bitbucket:

{code}
ssh -v -T git@bitbucket.org

debug1: sending SSH2_MSG_KEX_ECDH_INIT
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_ECDH_REPLY
debug1: Server host key: RSA 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40
debug1: Host 'bitbucket.org' is known and matches the RSA host key.
debug1: Found key in /home/pi/.ssh/known_hosts:2
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS received
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST sent
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_ACCEPT received
debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey
debug1: Next authentication method: publickey
debug1: Offering RSA public key: /home/pi/.ssh/id_rsa
debug1: Server accepts key: pkalg ssh-rsa blen 279
debug1: Authentication succeeded (publickey).
Authenticated to bitbucket.org ([104.192.143.1]:22).
debug1: channel 0: new [client-session]
debug1: Entering interactive session.
debug1: Sending environment.
debug1: Sending env LC_ALL = en_US.UTF-8
debug1: Sending env LANG = en_US.UTF-8
debug1: Sending env LC_CTYPE = UTF-8
debug1: channel 0: free: client-session, nchannels 1
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.


{code}

When I do the same from Mac OS X I am able to login:

{code}
<removed lines>
debug1: rekey after 4294967296 blocks
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS received
debug1: rekey after 4294967296 blocks
debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_ACCEPT received
debug1: Authentications that can continue: publickey
debug1: Next authentication method: publickey
debug1: Offering RSA public key: /Users/kees/.ssh/id_rsa
debug1: Server accepts key: pkalg ssh-rsa blen 279
debug1: Authentication succeeded (publickey).
Authenticated to bitbucket.org ([104.192.143.3]:22).
debug1: channel 0: new [client-session]
debug1: Entering interactive session.
debug1: pledge: network
debug1: Sending environment.
debug1: Sending env LC_ALL = en_US.UTF-8
debug1: Sending env LANG = en_US.UTF-8
debug1: Sending env LC_CTYPE = UTF-8
debug1: client_input_channel_req: channel 0 rtype exit-status reply 0
logged in as keesalbers.

You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled.
debug1: channel 0: free: client-session, nchannels 1
{code}

Any advice would be much appreciated!

fields.description:
I don't want to commit and push.  I have modified some code on my local.  I want to verify, if all the tests pass, with out doing the commit.  Is there a way to upload a diff to the pipelines.

Basically, I should upload my local changes or changesets with out commit and push.  This helps to avoid lot of unnecessary commits or experimental commits.

Sometimes, webdriver tests are very flaky.  We make changes and the changes should be pushed for testing on the bitbucket pipelines.

fields.description:
When user has a large number of open Pull Requests and is trying to reduce the number by declining them using API endpoint call to decline them,  we return a 500 error\\
Would be better to have "Your request has timed out" kind of message to provide a bit more details on why the request is failing\\
Example of the endpoint:\\
POST https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/team/repo/pullrequests
fields.summary: Improve timeout message for API calls on Pull Requests
Cannot remove "moved" repository.

fields.description:
Pull request may have many iterations. Reviewers write comments and pull request's creator has to fix/settle them. Until comments are not fixed reviewer has nothing to do with pull request.

A problem is that there aren't any info in pull request list (except of last updated time) which can help to recognize pull requests that can be reviewed and pull requests that are returned for fixing.

Reviewer can decline pull request and creator will create a new pull request after fixing all comments. But in this case all pull request's activities will be lost and reviewer must check all changes again instead of checking only new ones. That is why I avoid declining pull request if it is not completed or needed some changes.

For my opinion, the best solution would be a new status of pull request like - in progress or incomplete or something else. With this status reviewer would be able to mark a pull request and filter off it.

The simplest solution is changing additional info in pull reqeust list

from: *last updated 2 hours ago*

to: *last updated 2 hours ago by John Smith*

But this solution has many pros
fields.summary: Reviewing pull request improvments

fields.description:
h2. Issue
After creating a new repository, the repository URLs for HTTPS & SSH are not shown on the Dashboard tab (see attachment 'dashboard-empty-repo.png').

Once some commits have been pushed the URL component appears at the top of the Overview page (see attachment 'dashboard-after-commits.png').

Since these URLs are required to connect the remote repository to the one on my local computer, I would like to request that this component is always shown, even for newly created repositories.

h2. Additional Details
The HTTPS URL is shown in the 'Get Started' area but the SSH URL is not. For users, like myself, who connect solely through SSH, for the additional security it provides, this makes it very difficult to be sure of the correct URL to use.

I understand that the SSH URL has a specific format that I can piece together, however, I would prefer it if the interface showed this explicitly.
fields.summary: Always show repository URLs (HTTPS & SSH) on Overview page

fields.description:
The following is valid, but throws an error in the editor and when running a pipeline:

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - curl -X POST -u $BB_CREDENTIALS -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{\"name\":\"$BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER\",\"target\":{\"hash\":\"$BITBUCKET_COMMIT\"}}" https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER/$BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG/refs/tags
{code}

The string {{"Content-Type: application/json"}} gives the error:

{code}
Expected a string but found a mapping.
{code}

!1776528962-Screen%20Shot%202018-02-01%20at%202.45.14%20PM.png|thumbnail!

The work-around is to put {{"Content-type: application/json"}} in an environment variable:

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - curl -X POST -u $BB_CREDENTIALS -H "$CONTENT_TYPE" -d "{\"name\":\"$BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER\",\"target\":{\"hash\":\"$BITBUCKET_COMMIT\"}}" https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER/$BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG/refs/tags
{code}
fields.summary: bitbucket-pipeline.yml error: Expected a string but found a mapping

fields.description:
As a operator
 I want to be notified by email when a scheduled task failed to execute
 So that I can execute the task manually.
----
h3. Issue Summary

Scheduled pipelines fail to trigger email notifications on build failure events. It turns out to be a serious issue when build fails in non-working hours as the team is not aware of the failed scheduled builds
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure scheduled pipelines that result in failure
 # No notifications sent

h3. Expected Results

Email notifications should be sent to the watchers on the repository.
h3. Actual Results

No email notifications sent
h3. Workaround

 

To use [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/email-notify/src/master/] pipe to trigger an email

 
{code:java}
image: atlassian/default-image:2
pipelines:
  default:
      - step: 
              name: test email pipe
              script:
                - exit 1
              after-script:
                 - pipe: atlassian/email-notify:0.4.0
                   variables:
                      USERNAME: '<string>'
                      PASSWORD: '<string>'
                      FROM: '<string>'
                      TO: '<string>'
                      HOST: '<string>'
                      # PORT: '<string>' # Optional.
                      # TLS: '<boolean>' # Optional.
                      # SUBJECT: '<string>' # Optional.
                      # BODY_PLAIN: '<string>' # Optional.
                      # BODY_HTML: '<string>' # Optional.
                      # ATTACHMENTS: '<string>' # Optional.
                      # DEBUG: '<boolean>' # Optional.
{code}
fields.summary: Email notification for failed scheduled pipelines

fields.description:
In some cases, developers may review a pull-request that contains many files with many changes (in case of a big refactor or a new major feature).

In such cases, you may find yourself reviewing a PR which requires you to scroll around a huge page. (Let's not go into the best practice discussion that PRs should be small. Sadly, best practice are not always followed for various reasons).

It would be really helpful if there was an option to collapse all lines of a given file (for example, a file that has already been reviewed or a file that was auto-generate which we are not likely to review) - that way we won't need to scroll around a huge PR page. (keep in mind that files are ordered alphabetically in the PR and in no way in the logical order of what you're reviewing).
fields.summary: Allow collapsing files in pull-requests

fields.description:
h1. Steps
# Edit a file using the online editor.
# Click 'Commit'.
# In the dialog select "Create a pull request for this change". Don't select any reviewers.
# Click 'Commit'
# (BUG) UI will look like the attached screenshot. The error is actually: {"type": "error", "error": {"fields": {"reviewers": ["Malformed reviewers list"]}, "message": "Bad request"}}. The
# (BUG) Click commit. You will now get JS errors like:

{code}
Uncaught TypeError: this.commit is not a function
    at child.commitChanges (app.js:199800)
    at child.wrapper [as commitChanges] (vendor.js:49138)
    at HTMLDivElement.dispatch (vendor.js:67149)
    at HTMLDivElement.elemData.handle (vendor.js:66835)
{code}

You are now in a state:

# Where it is impossible to commit even if you add a reviewer.
# The branch has been created with the commit without the PR.

h1. Expected
Either the PR should be created with no reviewers (its possible) or the UI should not allow the commit to be pushed until a reviewer is entered. Also, it should be possible to resolve the problem (e.g. by adding a reviewer) and still create the branch.

It should not be possible to create the branch unless its going to be possible to create the review.
fields.summary: Creating a PR from a file edit with no reviewers leaves BB in inconsistent state

fields.description:
I have been very frustrated lately with the workflow for pull requests.\\
As your UI suggests, you must first enter a title.\\
Then, you can add more elaborate information for the reviewer.\\
The way I do that second step is that I look at the diff. So, I click on the _diff_ instead of the _commits_.\\
Then, I realize I (BTW, *ALWAYS*) want to ignore white spaces. So, I click on the ellipsis, select _ignore whitespaces_ and BAM! *all my work on this pull request is lost because the page refreshes*.

Either find a way to not lose my work when selecting _ignore whitespaces_ or please auto-save my draft (like you do in many other parts of the Atlassian ecosystem).
fields.summary: auto-save (draft) pull requests

fields.description:
!2927691081-Screen%20Shot%202018-01-30%20at%2019.16.52.png|thumbnail!

Backticks are often used to name test cases, apostrophes are pretty common in that names ("don't" word is pretty common in test cases), so this issue occurs pretty often. In classes with a lot of tests it's often that whole file loses it's syntax highlight which is pretty sad especially while code reviewing.

See here about backticks in Kotlin:

https://kotlinlang.org/docs/reference/java-interop.html#escaping-for-java-identifiers-that-are-keywords-in-kotlin
fields.summary: Kotlin syntax highlighter breaks when an apostrophe (') is between backticks (`) characters

fields.description:
If you have a test suite that contains multiple (embedded) tests suites, Bitbucket Pipelines will count the tests executed and failed twice. See for example https://bitbucket.org/graphicresources/tutpad_web/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/1706

The xml is something like this:

{code}
#!xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testsuites>
    <testsuite name="CodeIgniter Application Test Suite" tests="260" assertions="1110" failures="0" errors="9" time="51.481371">
        <testsuite name="Admin_course_test" file="/code/application/tests/unit/controllers/Admin_course_test.php" tests="7" assertions="45" failures="0" errors="3" time="3.380968">
            <testcase name="test_admin_create_course" class="Admin_course_test" file="/code/application/tests/unit/controllers/Admin_course_test.php" line="52" assertions="6" time="1.127683"/>
            [...]
      </testsuite>
    </testsuite>
</testsuites>

{code}

PHPUnit creates a global testsuite (named "CodeIgniter Application Test Suite" in our example) and puts all the tests suites inside this tag.

Also, for some reason, if I remove this external testsuite, leaving a flat list of testsuites, Bitbucket Pipelines does not parse my junit.xml, see for example this run:

https://bitbucket.org/graphicresources/tutpad_web/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/1707

The junit.xml is the same as before, except in this run I deleted the third line and the penultimate line with {{sed -i '3d;$!x' junit.xml}}. Pipelines did not found any tests in this xml, but it displayed no errors. I verified this file with verify-junit-xml (npm module) and it seems it does not have any errors.
fields.summary: Pipelines show 2 times the number of tests reported in junit.xml

fields.description:
I'm often editing my wiki remotely and then later upload my changes via {{git push}}.

For a couple of days this hasn't been working properly anymore. A push works and the content shows up in the wiki. The remote git repo however isn't updated. When fetching (or cloning) a little time later, the new commits have gone... (although the content is still visible in the wiki, including history)

Here's the link to my (private) wiki: https://bitbucket.org/pesche/dsa/wiki

* My last commit showing up in the repo is from 2018-01-18 (10c128a7)
* There are two commits not showing up: 9b810d65 and af534ae1
fields.summary: Push to Wiki fails to appear in Git Clone

fields.summary: Create repository failed

fields.description:
This is somehow related to :

BCLOUD-13806

I want to *fetch my 50 last pipelines* (because I cannot filter on this API, actually, I just want to get my last pipeline for a given branch).

To do so, since I can't simply ask to give me the 50 last pipelines, I need to do this :

* {{https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/\{user}/\{repo}/pipelines/?pagelen=1}}

which gives me a total of {{size=10415}} pipelines

then, I divide size by {{pagelen=208}} (10415 / 50)

then,

* {{https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/\{user}/\{repo}/pipelines/?page=208&pagelen=50}}

returns empty lists of pipelines, whereas it should return my last pipelines (modulo 50).

* {{https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/\{user}/\{repo}/pipelines/?page=200&pagelen=50}}

returns correct list, so I'm missing all my last pipelines (starting at page 201)

I haven't found any workaround.

Also note that everything would much simpler if we could add an _order_ parameter to the query.
fields.summary: Pagination workaround is not working for pipelines endpoint in API 2

fields.description:
Sometimes a deployment fails because of an issue on the target server.

It would be great to be able to rerun a failed deployment without running the full build pipeline that feeds into it
fields.summary: Rerun failed deployments

fields.description: It would be really nice to have the PR toolbar duplicated in the bottom. It happens all the time that you reach the bottom of the PR and forget to click "approve" just because the button is missing down there. Satisfaction of finishing and clicking that button can be incredible this way.
fields.summary: Show approve button in the bottom of PR

fields.description:
Hello,

we are experiencing a problem with the webhooks on our repository at the URL:

https://bitbucket.org/gs-iam/cid-core/admin/addon/admin/bitbucket-webhooks/bb-webhooks-repo-admin

When certificate verification is enabled for our endpoint, the webhooks are reporting back with a NET_ERR. If the certificate validation is turned off, then the webhooks are triggered fine. The NET_ERR problem was somewhat misleading as well. It would be great if it would report e.g. CERT_ERR if there's a problem with certificate validation.

regards

* Jani
fields.summary: Bitbucket Web hooks report NET_ERR on endpoint with EV Certificate

fields.description: Looking at Jira,want to import my issues from bitbucket - not finding an easy way so went to export and got this error.
fields.summary: Export issues from BitBucket Err - Permsion Denied:  32d4a928-74ca-44e2-bd81-6f6ef238e79a

fields.description:
We get randomly errors uploading artifacts. We are not over the 1GB limit, our artifacts are all together around 90MB, yet we see random failures.

See for example the result on this pipeline:

https://bitbucket.org/graphicresources/tutpad_web/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/1694

Typically if we rerun the pipeline it works.

I initially commented this bug in issue BCLOUD-15062 and was reopened but Matt Ryall closed it and suggested to open a new ticket as this seems to be a different error.
fields.summary: Random "Error occurred whilst uploading artifact"

fields.description:
Hi,

we have a respository I can not push because of error remote: repository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit).

Thanks
fields.summary: Can't push repository to bitbucket

fields.description:
Getting the following error:\\
We're unable to revert this pull request for the following reasons:

An unknown error occurred. Contact Bitbucket Support and provide the code e474e4de0c344118b3319cc1c6b81af5\\
You may need to manually revert these commits instead. Learn more about manually reverting.
fields.summary: Unable to revert a pull request

fields.description:
I have a Mercurial (hg) repository with a symlink in it that looks like this:

{code}
$ ls -l bin/
-rwxr-xr-x  1 rstocker  staff  789 25 Jan 10:42 deploy
lrwxr-xr-x  1 rstocker  staff    6 25 Jan 10:43 dev-deploy -> deploy
{code}

In {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}}, there's a step like this:

{code}
bin/dev-deploy
{code}

But running that step results in "Not found":

!3120290864-Screen%20Shot%202018-01-29%20at%2011.33.36.png|thumbnail!

Looking at the commands before the failing step, the symlink seems to be there, so not sure what's going on. The same setup works with a Git repository.

See Pipeline here: https://bitbucket.org/bitbucket/django-piston/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/48

And the branch: https://bitbucket.org/bitbucket/django-piston/branch/rstocker/deploy-to-artifactory-test
fields.summary: Relative symlink in Mercurial (hg) repository doesn't work in Pipelines build

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to direct 'private comments/suggestions' to a pull request review. Sometimes I want to make suggestions to the PR author without it appearing publicly. I often make suggestions in tools like Slack/Skype/etc to the author instead when a suggestion can be interpreted as "nit-picky" or could potentially make me appear like "know-it-all" if done publicly.

All comments in this thread should be invisible to anyone but the suggester and the pull request author(s).
fields.summary: Private pull request review comments/suggestions

fields.description:
When a PR is created from a forked repo or a branch, and during the merge a Squash merge is selected, once the merge is completed you will not be able to view the DIFF of that merged commit and instead will see a message:\\
"Nothing to merge. The source or destination branch was deleted or these changes already exist in the destination repository."
fields.summary: When squash merging a  PR - the Diff will not be shown anymore in the UI on merged PR (BBCDEV-8967)

fields.description:
Hi

I have a repository that is reported to be in size of 1.3GB, but when I clone the repository to my computer the size is only 284MB.\\
The local repository size used to be around 1GB and I used garbage collection to reduce it (succesfully), but for some reason the remote repo  (source) size didn't reduce.\\
I'd be happy to get your help.

yours,\\
Or
fields.summary: size reported in repo setting is different then clone repo size

fields.description: At the end of my pipeline I have a script that takes the artifacts and sends them to the remote server with ssh (scp, to be exact). Since yesterday all our builds get stuck at this step and are killed after 120 minutes waiting for the connection.
fields.summary: Can’t connect to the remote server from the pipeline

fields.description:
We have setup a bitbucket.io page and we'd want that each client has a documentation folder/url.\\
Like,

* account.bitbucket.io/client1
* account.bitbucket.io/client2
* account.bitbucket.io/client3
* etc...

we need somewhat like a password to access each folder/url just like the functionality of having an .htaccess.

How can I possibly do that?
fields.summary: Secure Bitbucket.io Pages

fields.description:
Hi everyone.

I want to tell you about our bad experience with a sqhash commit option in Pull Request optons.

When you try to make a sqhash commit based on other squashed commits your system could become to an absolutely unstable state.

Once, one of our colleagues has merged the base branch into his develop branch where was lots of sqhashed commits with very big commit messages and when he has merged his PR, his new sqhashed commit message was of million lines of text.

Some time after that we have started to point out that our systems cannot work with such big commit messages.

Bitbucket itself denying to show this commit in its commit history, responding with the 500 response code.

Whan can I ask you guys is to set-up a limit for a sqhashed commit message.

While users are not able to limit sqashed commits messages there is a big bomb hidden instide of this option.

So I request you guys to make a new feature to have an ability to limit squash commit on PR merge.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Squash merge with million lines

fields.description:
Customers are experiencing an error\\
" Unexpected error"\\
when exporting issues from Bitbucket Cloud repo.\\
Also the email is sent to the requester stating:\\
"\\
Your issue export for the repository account/repo_slug failed.\\
The error was: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/data/c01/n01/p/vpcache/issue-exporter'\\
If you'd like to contact support, please provide us with this key: aac79706-dfb8-4ee3-9567-203bd5bce8e3. It will help us diagnose the problem."
fields.summary: Cannot export issues from Bitbucket repo (BBCDEV-8851)

fields.description:
Sometimes the user would make a commit and run a build on that commit and realize that they have committed sensitive data in plain text.\\
They would then subsequently delete the commit or the file/files and re-write repo history to remove the data from the repo. However that will not affect the run pipelines and that information will still be available through pipelines build.\\
Would be good to add functionality to allow the user to purge the information somehow or allow them to delete builds if possible.
fields.summary: Have the ability to purge sensitive data from pipelines logs

fields.description:
Working with branch permissions is getting a little annoying when you work with hotfixes. Prefixed branches with {{hotfix/}} should be merged to develop and master instead of one single branch.

Currently we have configured Bitbucket to have x number of approvals before you can merge to the destination branch. Once you've got the approvals and you're merging a hotfix to the master branch, you have to create a new PR for merging to develop. And again you have to wait for approvals.

A git flow approach would be great here.

Related to BCLOUD-12833
fields.summary: Workflows for Bitbucket cloud (git flow)

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to be able to specify environment variables on a project level as well.

We are a company with multiple big independent projects. We put company specific variables (e.g. credentials to artifact repository) at team level and any artifact specific variable at repository level. However, since all artifacts in a project should be deployed to the same environment would we like to put variables such as development environment, test environment etc. at project level. Putting them in pipeline configuration or at repository level would be too cumbersome and to put it at team level would clutter those settings (i.e. for each project adding PROJECT_DEVELOPMENT_ENVIRONMENT, test etc. to team settings).

I think this is a valid use case for the requested feature and hope to see it in the future!
fields.summary: Add support for environment variables at project level

fields.description: It would be very helpful to be able to trigger a Pipeline run when a Pull Request is opened (in our case to run code analysis). Ideally by either specifying a custom Pipeline to be run or by having the ability to define a specific "pull-request" Pipeline in bitbucket-pipelines.yml.
fields.summary: Trigger Pipeline on Pull Request

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Bitbucket raises "Something went wrong" error when user tries to access attachment on issue tracker if the file named in non-ASCII.

h2. How to Replicate
* Create an arbitrary file named in non-ASCII characters such as by {{echo "Hello" >> "日本語.txt"}}
* Create a repository
* Enable issue tracker
* Go to _Create issue_ > _Select files_ > Choose the file created at 1st step > Select _Create issue_
* Access the file's link
* Confirm Bitbucket raises "Something went wrong" error

h2. Investigation Done
Bitbucket Cloud complains the error below:

{code}
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe6 in position 198: ordinal not in range(128)
{code}

Verified at https://bitbucket.org/i05/issue_tracker_15563/issues/1/jpns-18533 (private).
fields.summary: Unable to access issue attachment if the filename contains non-ASCII character

fields.description:
Hi there,

I'm using SourceTree and get the following message so frequently, even though I saved them in the program.\\
When the message shows up, I need to wait 10 min or some.\\
All of colleagues have same trouble.\\
I guess somebody using same public ip (211.48.51.34) input wrong id/password.\\
If bitbucket server blocks signing up for a while once somebody in the IP inputs wrong values, it must be totally problematic strategy.\\
Please let me know the solution.

Thanks

--------  Message -------\\
"git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --set-upstream origin refs/heads/tmonbuildtest-1:refs/heads/tmonbuildtest-1\\
Pushing to https://kyungjeon@bitbucket.org/findainc/finda-web.git\\
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.\\
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://kyungjeon@bitbucket.org/findainc/finda-web.git/'\\
Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: Frequent "Invalid username and password" message

fields.description: On windows ir any other systems when setting the repo icon I can click on the icon itself and drag it to the area, on my iPhone I can only zoom it or out. There is got to be an way that after tapping that image box to have it where my fingers do the same thing as I can on my laptop and then press Done or something after that. Or maybe an mobile web mode of the repo settings perhaps that allows this?
fields.summary: Changing an repo icon in Safari in iOS does not let you move the an certain area of the icon.

fields.description: I would like to be able to post comments to a pull request on behalf of a bitbucket connect application. This functionality is critical to our application's use case of posting inline comments to our user's pull requests. This already exists with GitHub apps, and was surprised to learn that you get a 403 when trying to post a comment as an integration in bitbucket.
fields.summary: Post comment on behalf of Bitbucket Connect Application

fields.description:
When you create a new branch, you choose what branch it should be cut from.  It then redirects you to the branch page for that new branch (e.g. bitbucket.org/user/repo/branch/new-branch-name).

On that page, it will by default compare it to the default branch of the repo (usually {{master}}).  Instead, I think the branch creation page should populate the {{dest}} query parameter to match the branch you chose on the previous page, so that it compares to the branch you'd expect it to.
fields.summary: Branch page should have `dest` query param set when coming from branch creation page

fields.description: Looks like pipeline webhook notifications can only be setup for "Build status created" and "Build status updated" triggers.  That looks unfamiliar to me, I'd like to activate notification for build failures only.  Is that possible?
fields.summary: Webhook notification for pipeline failure only

fields.description:
Hi

Recently we've suddenly noticed all our builds are failing with

{code}
unexpected EOF
{code}

(during our Dockerised [Stack|https://github.com/commercialhaskell/stack]-based Haskell compilation)

(e.g. [this build|https://bitbucket.org/rezonence/website-builder/addon/pipelines/home#%21/results/433])

This is _not_ repeatable either using local builds with the native tooling, or even running the Docker-based builder locally (using this is largely in order to make our builds repeatable and investigatable!)

Can we get some more information about what is happening in the Docker Daemon here? It sounds to me like a networking failure, or an out-of-disk-space type of situation, but again we have no way of replicating, and all *our builds are blocked* :(

Thanks
fields.summary: EOF errors in Docker-based pipelines builds

fields.description:
Users can upload files named with Korean Characters to the Issues page but received "Something went wrong" while viewing/downloading the attachment.

Notes:\\
Attached text files to show the above-mentioned issue.\\
With error - "안녕 세상.txt "\\
Without error - "15556-Bug.txt"
fields.summary: Unable to download file named with Korean Characters from Issue page

fields.description:
When a user accepts an invite to a Bitbucket Account / Repository, user will be redirected to an Atlassian Account page to create a new account (if there is no Atlassian Account of the email address).

On that page, there is an incorrect message as below.

Message : We need a few details, to create an account for [object Object].

!2399770393-bug.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When accepting invite to a Repository, redirects to create a Atlassian Account shows incorrect message.

fields.description:
Pull request that generates this issue:\\
https://bitbucket.org/curvecard/ios-curve-app/pull-requests/738
fields.summary: Not possible to see overview of changes in the pull request.  "Error" "We were unable to load this page."

fields.description:
I have been given access to a bitbucket project:\\
https://bitbucket.org/tempusintel/tempusbot

But it gives me denied access, although I have write access to the project.\\
What can I do to enter tempusbot?
fields.summary: Access denied in a repository that I have write permissions.

fields.description: On the pull requests page, it would be very helpful to have a filter to see all of the PRs I am reviewing AND ones that I have yet to approve/decline (basically ones that need my attention.)
fields.summary: Filter for "I'm Reviewing" AND "I have not reviewed"

fields.description:
Hello,

We are using a couple of submodules and when we do merging from our "main" repo we just see "sha/hash changes" it would be awesome if you in the PR / Merge request would be able to see WHAT changes have been done on each submodule.

So basically a diff for each submodule that has changed.
fields.summary: Submodules support in pull requests

fields.description: We need to find total size of all repositories under skava-admin(Team). We raised a support ticket to atlassian and they gave us the size,but it will be very helpful if we could see it by ourself.please let us know if there is any functionality to accomplish the same.
fields.summary: Need to find the total size of all repositories

fields.description: Minor detail, but maybe include on the difference between these variable references to avoid confusion when using environment variables.
fields.summary: Pipeline docs: Add in difference between $variables and ${variables}

fields.description:
Hi there, currently running the follow:

{code}
#!yml

image: node:9.0.0
pipelines:
  branches:
    feature/*:
      - step:
          caches:
            - node
          script:
            - curl -o- -L https://yarnpkg.com/install.sh | bash -s -- --version 0.24.6
            - export PATH=$HOME/.yarn/bin:$PATH
            - set NODE_ENV=production
            - yarn
            - yarn global add gulp
            - npm link gulp
            - ls -a
            - yarn build
{code}

When it runs build it runs a gulp task that hashes images and then runs a webpack build. However it would seem that these dependencies listed in my package.json are not in node_modules or working at all? Is there a reason or something I am missing?

Attached an image of the build errors. I don't understand why I would have to install each dependency manually?
fields.summary: Installing Gulp and Running Webpack

fields.description:
Dear Bitbucket,

Since the appearance of the novel interface to manage my repositories, it became more difficult to merge my initial repository to the forked repository.

I believe that this page is out of date.\\
https://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/02/04/syncing-and-merging-come-to-bitbucket/

I would like to merge my repository "spp-extended-theory" to "LIPSS-database" (and NOT the opposite). Actually, the main purpose is for me to HIDE the contents of LIPSS-database to users of spp-extended-theory, as the routines included in the second latter remain unpublished in scientific litterature.

Thanks for your assistance,

Best wishes,\\
Thibault Derrien
fields.summary: Merge fork with master is out of order.

fields.description:
I should show the local time, not the GMT time

!1174694811-Screen%20Shot%202018-01-22%20at%204.12.31%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show localized time instead of UTC time on timestamp hover

fields.description:
Scenario 1: No Atlassian Account and Bitbucket account

Creating new Bitbucket account will also set up Atlassian account with password

Scenario 2: Have Atlassian Account but don't have Bitbucket account

When creating Bitbucket account using Google auth, you will be prompted to a page to enter your email address. Once enter the email address, you will be prompted again to another page where you need to enter Atlassian account password in order to link your new created Bitbucket and Atlassian account.

You will be able to log into Atlassian account using Google Auth. However, there is no Atlassian account password configured.

Hence, you will need to perform reset password for Atlassian account (Atlassian account page) to set up a password for Atlassian account. Once this is done, you will successfully sign into Bitbucket account.
fields.summary: Google Auth need to setup password for Old Atlassian account to link newly created Bitbucket account.

fields.description:
No deploy, the pipeline script never finish.\\
This scripts was working before, without problem
fields.summary: No deploy pipeline

fields.description:
I previously registered an SSH key on my bitbucket account. After merging into an Atlassian account, the SSH key no longer appears in my SSH key settings. However, it seems like the key is still registered, as I cannot re-register the key (it citing "Someone has already registered this as a deploy key." as the reason).

This is pretty serious, as I no longer have control to deactivate this SSH key in the case of a compromise.
fields.summary: SSH key goes missing after bitbucket/atlassian account merge.

fields.description:
While confering the pipeline for ruby script, I am getting "Could not locate Gemfile" error.\\
Kindly look into issue.

{code}
image: ruby:2.4.0
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - ruby - v
          - bundle install
{code}
fields.summary: pipeline script  - bundle install "Could not locate Gemfile"

hi team,

we are using bitbucket pipeline and deployment future in bitbucket.\\
we had a problem  our pipeline dashboard not updating  build information\\
build going on perfectly  we can able to see in commit location ( in the index there is build  under the build we can able to see a build info)

fields.description:
delete big file, but size repository has not diminished, although the download size was smaller.

Web site size:

!2097053867-%D0%A1%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%BE%D0%BA%20%D1%8D%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0%202018-01-19%20%D0%B2%2012.18.28.png|thumbnail!

Download size:  Repository.zip,  - 53 MB

Git clone (mirror)  - 36 MB.

Git Large File Storage is  - 0 bytes.

Update:

I wrote in those support and they created magic, now the repository has a size of 35 mb.
fields.summary: Fix reduce repository size

fields.description: In pull request activity log, the time shown when hovering the duration(x minutes ago)/time is in GMT time zone not the local time. Everywhere else it shows local time.
fields.summary: Timezone in activity log

fields.description:
When reviewing a Pull Request, it would be nice to be able to do the following:

* Reviewer makes a comment
* Author pushes additional changes to branch
* Reviewer views updated code, and marks Comment as Resolved.

It would be useful for ordinary change-set code reviews as well.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Resolve Comment

fields.description:
The description of a PR is created from a commit message.

If you write a long commit message (see http://tbaggery.com/2008/04/19/a-note-about-git-commit-messages.html), the line wraps are lost in the PR description. This looks weird.
fields.summary: Line wrap of long commit message is lost in PR description

fields.description:
Hi

We need to find last Login details of all users in Bitbucket Cloud.Could you please let us know if there is any function to find this.
fields.summary: Need to find last Login details of users in bitbucket cloud

fields.description:
Hello,

We use repository archive downloading functionality as part of our automation. After Bitbucket incident a week ago (https://status.bitbucket.org/incidents/z029156p1svh) this functionality is much less reliable.\\
Repositories downloads often times out (for downloads of few MBs to few dozen MBs - that normally take just few seconds); sometimes the downloaded zip archive is invalid.

Is there any new throttling mechanism limiting this feature?

We can provide exact times and links if it helps the investigation.

Thanks and regardds
fields.summary: Bitbucket repository archive download sluggish last few days
Getting 500 when accessing the /branches API on my repo

fields.description:
!1395138530-filename.png|thumbnail!

If the file name with Chinese characters, it will be displayed as messy code. I think this maybe a bug.
fields.summary: Chinese file name will be displayed as garbled code

fields.description:
We had an example of a merge from a feature branch to develop branch where the change was not actually reflected in develop after clicking the merge button.

We know this isn't an issue where someone force pushed develop in a different state because directly pushing to develop or master is prohibited in our repo.

Other developers confirmed that by all appearances in BitBucket UI the merge was completed correctly but the commit and merge commit never showed up in the destination branch.

This report differs from\\
BCLOUD-15399 because the merge was shown to be completed but the commit did not actually appear in the branch. Unlike other merges, the merge was shown as "<user> remotely merged the pull request from <feature branch> to develop" This merge was performed in the identical manner as other merges (BitBucket user interface) so it's unclear why the message varies in this case.

Priority marked as minor because it only happened once but is arguably major because this caused a bug on a production website.
fields.summary: Merge shown as complete in UI but not committed to destination branch

fields.description: The pipelines on-boarding takes you through a really nice process of setting up a bitbucket-pipelines.yml file. However, for a repository with restrictions on how one can merge to master (ie. a PR with approvals is required) - the on-boarding breaks. It would be nice if in the case that a commit to master is not possible, the on-boarding generates a PR with the .yml file you just created.
fields.summary: Pipelines onboarding to support repos with merge checks

fields.description: I just wish I could get rid of the damn things, I set up some experimental ones that fail. Thank you!
fields.summary: Functional - ability to remove build pipelines

fields.description:
I have set up pipelines to report unit test failures.  It's showing the number of failed tests, but I can't get it to display the messages associated with the failures.

Here's how it looks in pipelines:

!2162256448-healthleads%20_%20HL-Salesforce%20_%20Add-on%20_%20Pipelines%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket-000126.png|thumbnail!

Here's the relevant section of the XML file with test failure:

!3300049417-Clipboard-000128.png|thumbnail!

Note that this is generated using {{tap-xunit}} which doesn't generate any children within the {{<failure>}} element.
fields.summary: Pipelines not displaying test failure messages
